Crime_Name: Request for Review of Conviction under Section 690 of the Criminal Code
Legal_Issue: Whether a declaration can be obtained via action or requires judicial review regarding a mercy request decision
Procedural_Stage: Motion to strike out Statement of Claim
Decision_Outcome: Action not plainly futile; Plaintiff granted 45 days to convert to judicial review
Legal_Rule: Decisions under section 690 of the Criminal Code are subject to judicial review; declarations against federal bodies require judicial review applications
Procedural_Issue: Appropriate procedure for challenging a federal tribunal's inaction: action vs. judicial review
Grounds_for_Claim: Dissatisfaction with handling of mercy request
Outcome_on_Merits: Not decided on merits; procedural determination made
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Application may proceed if converted properly
Key_Evidence_Considered: Defendantâ€™s argument that judicial review is required; lack of formal decision by Department of Justice
Legal_Framework: Federal Court Rules, Rule 57 (conversion of action to judicial review)
Applicant_Challenge: Seeking declaration on Minister's decision regarding mercy request
Court_Result: Plaintiff given 45 days to file time extension and convert action to judicial review; otherwise, action will be struck out
Defendant_Response: Argued that judicial review was required, not an action
Remedy_Requested: Declaration regarding handling of mercy request
Outcome: Action conditionally maintained pending conversion to judicial review
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Improper use of action instead of judicial review
Outcome_of_Review: Pending outcome; conditional allowance to proceed with conversion
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Application for time extension and conversion under Rule 57
